intro: Melilotus segetalis, commonly known as field melilot, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features slender, branching stems that grow up to 1 meter in height, often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Melilotus segetalis is known for its high content of volatile oils and is used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
